basics.name: Shuai Victor Zhou
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an undergrad student at UC Berkeley studying Computer Science and Mathematics. I come from a background of competitive math, physics, and engineering. In my free time, I enjoy hiking, learning languages, creating videos, watching shows, and playing poker.

work.summary: Built the MA-1 portable mercury detector application and ran lab tests for the sensors. Worked closely with customers for improving the quality and creating the features to meet their needs. Spearheaded the development and customery discovery for the fluid mercury sensor.
Began education at Berkeley, majoring in Computer Science and Mathematics.
Taught competition-level mathematics and advanced topics in the Science Bowl competition to elementary and middle school students.
Conducted research in graph theory at Rice University's Department of Computational and Applied Math under Professor Illya V. Hicks.
Founded my high school's Physics Club. Coordinated volunteering at our local middle school with a specially curated curriculum of notes and problem sets.

skills.name: Backend
skills.x_description: Python, Java, C++, C, React.js, MATLAB, R, RISC-V Assembly, Golang
